Leads and applies chemicals like aluminum sulfate, liquid chlorine, polymer, caustic soda, calcium hypochlorite, potassium permanganate, lime, etc. 2. Monitors hourly treatment chemical consumption to ensure chemical feed rates correspond to the recommended dosage and flow of raw water less the leaks and losses for accurate treatment and efficient results of water quality. 4. Inspects, receives and records treatment chemical deliveries together with the Warehouse Representative during the shift and update stock balance. 5. Maintains and repairs minor defect of equipment/instruments and reports major defects for immediate repair. 6. Maintains cleanliness and orderliness of workstation, dosing equipment and appurtenances including tools used such as pliers, wrenches, vise grip, chlorine special tool, breathing apparatus, etc. for workers and visitor safely. 7. Accepts and records chemical deliveries. 8. Reports and follow-up on some improvements like overseeing the accuracy of accepting chemical deliveries, improving chemical handling and application techniques and equipment and facilities performance monitoring. 9. Monitors/measures the volume of raw water and treated water by means of ultrasonic flowmeters and reports any major damage of equipment/facilities to WSO Officer on duty for immediate action to minimize downtime. 10. Implements Energy Management System & Integrated Management System’s programs, activities, procedures and policies 11. Does other related tasks as may be assigned QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS MINIMUM EDUCATION Graduate of any engineering course preferably in civil or mechanical Must be a licensed Engineer WORK EXPERIENCE Preferably with one to three years of related work experience KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, and ABILITIES Computer skills (MS Office) Written and verbal communication skills Interpersonal skills Analytical skills PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES/ATTITUDES Willing to work additional hours in order to meet targets and tight deadlines With high customer service orientation Results-driven and proactive Can work with minimal supervision Can work under pressure With pleasing personality Capable and willing to go on shifts WORKPLACE RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENT EQUIPMENT/SOFTWARE USED Computer MS Office WORKING CONDITIONS and OCCUPATIONAL HAZARDS Exposed to weather and field conditions during regular rounds of treatment plant facilities Always on call

About the role: A permanent opportunity has become available for a proactive and enthusiastic Mechanical Engineer to support our busy Engineering Team. Callidus provide engineering design and optimization services for valves and process flow equipment within Oil/Gas and Mining sectors. The role will support the technical delivery of projects internally and directly to the clients. JOB SUMMARY: Establish technical documentation. Design valve components, assemblies and related equipment. Produce manufacturing drawings, sketches and assembly drawings. Ensure that engineering documents are carried out accordingly to company standards and clients’ requirements. RESPONSIBILITIES Establish technical documentation such as calculations, procedures, datasheets, technical proposals and engineering reports. Produce manufacturing drawings, sketches and assembly drawings in accordance with Company drawing standards. Manage drawings and other technical documents using PDM. Design valve components, assemblies and related equipment according to relevant standards. Calculations for sizing and selection of Pressure Safety Valves and Control Valves. Valve and actuator design calculation in accordance with industry standards. Provide technical support to workshop, shutdown teams and clients. Create / review technical documents for specification and procurement of valves. Data management of project and design documents. Liaise with client, supplier and internal personnel. Any other tasks deemed necessary by management to perform the role. COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering / Preferably Board Passer 2 years experience on related field. Must have experience in designing and detailing mechanical parts. Must have background on data management applications. Experience with EPDM is an advantage. Must have knowledge and experience in preparation of engineering reports and other technical related documents. Sound understanding of pressure systems including piping, vessel, flanges, bolting. Sound understanding of project documents including PID’s, PDF, Equipment Datasheets and Specifications. Knowledge on industry standard for design, sizing and selection of valves. Good time management skills, high work ethics. High level of English competency both written and verbal communication. Strong customer service skills. Demonstration of organization and planning skills. Competency in Microsoft and Engineering computer packages and relevant software applications. Familiarity with common mechanical fabrication methods and limitations. Must have experience in developing 3D models and detailed drawing using Solidworks, at least 2 years experience. Background on FEA is desired. Thorough understanding of material properties to be able to assess material options in the design solution. Ability to coordinate projects and work with various departments within the organization Focused, systematic with good analytical skills. Commitment to attention to detail and meeting deadlines. Ability to work as part of a team as well as on their own initiative. SAFETY REQUIREMENTS Work within the safety first environment / culture with other members of your team and encourage safe behaviour. Job Description: Position Title: Fitment Supervisor Location: Makati City (Areas: Metro Manila & Central Luzon) Job Type: Full-time/Permanent Industry: Telematics/Automotive Job Responsibilities: Manage a team of installation technicians to ensure they install, repair or remove our devices at our client’s premises within a short turnaround time; Ensure fast and accurate scheduling of installations upon confirmation with customers Coordinate with different parties within the business to ensure our product has been successfully implemented, tested and working according to customer needs; Monitor the daily installation statistics (New, Repair, Retrieved) and are responsible for technicians’ productivity, quality and standard of work; Maintain and manage quality of installations and hardware on a daily basis; Resolve customers’ enquiries and ensure proper follow-up and execution to the final closure; Execute on the mechanical and electrical integration into vehicles of various telematics products including, but not limited to CAN Bus, OBD2, J1939, J1708 and other vehicle communication protocols and third-party sensors; Ensuring the accuracy of physical inventory levels & operating cost on fitments are closely monitored and replenished as needed. Upskill and train technicians as needed; Supporting all existing internal & external parties including resolving user problems and working in a team to ensure a stable, secure and reliable operational environment; Ensure quality customer service and maintaining good phone etiquette; Technology experience to ensure comprehensive knowledge of the full fleet management product offering; Maintain and monitor the company vehicles/motorcycles to ensure they are tracked, roadworthy and clean. Job Requirements: Candidate must possess at least Vocational course, Diploma in Automotive, Electrical/Electronic, Mechanical or equivalent; At least 5 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position; Experience/Knowledge of Electronics and Automotive aftermarket product installations (Telematics/Sound Systems/Immobilizer etc.); Experience/Knowledge of Electrical/Mechanical repair of Automobiles and/or Heavy vehicles; (Electrical wiring repair, Faulty Finding and Mechanical Repair etc.); Computer Literate with experience/ knowledge in software application usage and PC troubleshooting; Must be a firm leader that can execute independently and maintain high team morale; Must have management experience and must be hands-on; Strong analytical problem-solving skills and solutions oriented.

Function and Scope: The Project Manager – F&B position is responsible for and accountable to the development, implementation and execution of the overall division service plan to ensure that the division’s sales and profit objectives are obtained. Key areas of responsibility include: Personnel Management, Information Management, Business Management, Partnership Management, and Asset Management. Essential Functions/ Responsibilities Typical Essential Functions include but are not limited to the following: PERSONNEL MANAGEMENT : Hire, train and develop new service representatives where and when necessary in accordance with the personnel plan and the overall area and division business plan. Develop individual plans for success, growth and career objectives recognizing that individuals are uniquely motivated. Coach and develop through formal training programs and regular informal sessions to upgrade associates’ knowledge and skills. Coach associates through regular field work “ride-withs” providing performance and development assessment through honest, constructive analysis and feedback. Communicate as the team leader; divisional goals, objectives, programs and policies to insure understanding and buy-in. Motivate, recognize and reward individual and team achievement effectively and in a timely fashion. BUSINESS MANAGEMENT: Develop and achieve personal equipment sales budget. Develop and achieve division service objectives by motivating service reps to accomplish their service plans. Integrate knowledge of overall programs including service, training, equipment, products and support to provide best solutions to existing and new customers. Develop and analyze individual service reps service plans to achieve division goals. Direct time and territory management, planning and call activity to create a high level of customer satisfaction through proper needs and expectation analysis, rapid response, excellence in results, value added service and effective customer communication Retain, penetrate and grow existing customers by creating high customer satisfaction, through service excellence, good communication, building of strong relationships, value added programs and resolving customer concerns, issues or problems quickly, effectively and completely. Plan service strategies to encompass all available customer markets: brewery, beverage, dairy and food processing. Participate in seminar and training programs, blitzes and cross-divisional sales opportunities to maximize sales growth potential. INFORMATION MANAGEMENT: Know the Division goals, objectives and focus. Know how to integrate and use all sales, service and management tools. Thoroughly understand the key reporting requirements including weekly and/or monthly sales plan and service register, daily activity recaps, service reports, monthly progress report and monthly quarterly and/or annual executive business reviews (EBR’s) for key accounts. Insure that customer account service records are continuously updated and maintained. PARTNERSHIP MANAGEMENT: Build strong relationships with all corporate accounts, key customers and other Ecolab associates. Foster cross-divisional relationships and selling opportunities to insure the Ecolab Circle the Customer-Circle the Globe corporate business strategy. Communicate effectively and build results oriented relationships with all departments including Finance & Administration, Operations, Customer Service, and Technical. ASSET MANAGEMENT: Responsible for the control of F & B engineering equipment inventory management including customer equipment-on-loan records maintenance and on-site validation & audit of installations.

Job Description Service Mechanic performs skilled tasks in the mechanical and electrical repair and maintenance of heavy trucks, earth moving and related construction equipment. Job Description: -Diagnoses, services and repairs various systems that are found on pieces of heavy equipment such as mechanical and electronic controls, air brake systems, transmissions, high voltage generators, and pneumatic systems; -Troubleshoots and repairs malfunctions in the equipment; -Fabricates, modifies and installs special equipment or replacement parts; -Performs routine maintenance checks and adjustments on fluid levels, hoses, belts, brakes, tires and clutches; -Changes filters and oil, and lubricate vehicles and motor driven equipment; -Diagnoses problems, disassembles units, repairs or replaces parts, and reassembles units; -Overhauls engines, replaces engines, and rebuilds components; -Tunes gas and diesel engines; services valves; fuels filters and turbo chargers; and pressure checks fuel filters; and -Prepares work orders and cost material estimates. Skills and Competencies: -Mechanical aptitude; -Knowledgeable about the fundamentals of diesel engines, transmission, electrical systems, computers, and hydraulics; -Care and use of hand and power tools employed in all phases of heavy equipment mechanical maintenance and repair work; -Ability to make skillful, controlled manipulations of small objects to repair equipments; and Ability to read, understand, and carry out oral and written instructions. Physical Attributes and Characteristics -Flexible and have the capacity to learn new skills quickly; and -Physically fit (i.e. can move heavy objects; bend or stoop repeatedly over time)

• 3-5 years of experience • Automotive/Hydraulic/Mechanical Engr. Graduate • Who specialize in working with heavy machinery used in construction • Work with the biggest engines, inspecting, servicing, and repairing any damage to the engine or vehicle. • Certification as a Heavy Equipment Mechanic. • Work experience Heavy Equipment Mechanic. • Extensive knowledge of engines and construction equipment. • Ability to work after-hours if required. • Good communication skills.

Ensure installation technicians has sufficient inventory to fulfil their schedules and that the inventory levels are at all times sufficient to sustain business growth; Ensure technicians are performing according to our standards continually - including quality assurance and KPI’s. Job Title: QC Inspector - Mechanical and Piping Urgent!
Job Description: Candidate must possess at least Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Mechanical), Engineering (Mechatronic/Electromechanical) or equivalent. Registered Mechanical Engineer. At least 8 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. With experience in water and wastewater treatment, especially MWSS projects (Manila Water and Maynilad) Able to read installation manuals, international standards (ASME, ISO, BS, API, AWS Piping and welding standards) and prepare Inspection reports, Method statements, and procedures. Knowledgeable in NDT, Welding (ideally certified Welding inspector), Painting, able to review RT films. QC Inspector - Mechanical Coordinate with the Mechanical Supervisors. Conduct site inspections according to ITP for Mechanical equipment (pumps, blowers, screens, penstocks, mixers, tanks, etc) and steel structures during erection and pre-commissioning. Coordinate with Subcontractor and Engineer for inspections. Prepare and revise IT P and test report templates. Prepare and fill in inspection reports. Conduct material delivery inspections. Prepare and fill in material inspection reports. Prepare NCR (Non-conformity reports) as necessary. And ensure the follow up. Assist in Method statement preparation. Provide updates for weekly reports. Support to the Piping & Elec. QC inspectors, as necessary. QC Inspector - Piping Coordinate with the Piping Supervisor. Conduct site inspections according to ITP for Piping works (GRP, Stainless steel, PVC, HDPE, Carbon steel, Ductile iron piping — aboveground and underground) during prefabrication at workshop and, at site during erection and pre-commissioning. Prepare marked-up isometric with field and shop welds. Conduct inspection for fit-up, welding, NDT, pickling, line check, pressure test, etc Coordinate with Subcontractor, Supervisor, and Engineer for inspections. Prepare and revise IT P and test report templates. Prepare and fill in inspection reports. Conduct material inspections at delivery for pipe supports, pipe, fittings, in-line instrumentation. Prepare and fill in material inspection reports. Prepare or review weld book (weld traceability), pressure test package, etc Prepare NCR (Non-conformity reports) as necessary. Do the follow up. Assist in Method statement preparation. Provide updates for weekly reports and KPI for Piping progress. Support Mechanical & Elec. QC inspectors as necessary. Note: All benefits will be given on the first day of reporting for duty. With transportation allowance Meal allowance All dependents are covered by our HMO provider. With comprehensive insurances coverage Salary offer: Php 50,000 - 60,000, depending on the experience. Attach your updated CV. A Country Manager - Service (Automotive) job has just become available at a company that manufactures the largest range of two-wheelers in Asia and some parts of the world. About the Country Manager - Service (Automotive) Role: This role is crucial for the company's growth in the Philippine market. The main objective of this role is to achieve customer satisfaction by ensuring the availability of service and spare parts to all customers. Key Responsibilities: Plan and conduct customer engagement programmes (care camps, mobile service, customer meets, do-it-yourself training) to improve customer satisfaction and NPS Review customer complaints and put effective preventive actions Ensure assembly quality as per standards at distributor assembly plant and provide product performance feedback regularly to headquarters to improve product quality Ensure settlement of distributor claims such as transit, warranty, spare parts etc. and handle distributor queries Improve service and parts reach by network expansion and improve service quality by adherence to service processes (training, audit, implementation and usage of DMS) Understand market dynamics (in terms of service and parts) and suggest appropriate measures (new product launches, network, pricing and new initiatives of competition) Develop programmes/actions to improve service inflow and parts sales of distributors/dealers Ensure availability of genuine spare parts in all the distributor/dealer/3S/2S and APS/retailers outlets to achieve retail plan To be successful in this role, you must have both sales and service management experience in the automotive industry. Key Requirements: Six to eight years of experience in aftersales/service management in the automotive industry In-depth technical knowledge in spare parts and service management Skilled in customer engagement and satisfaction Engineering/technical degree Sales experience in the automotive (parts) industry Experience in OEM is a must This company is a well-known brand in Asia and is aggressively growing in the Philippines. Great career progression opportunities await in this Country Manager - Service (Automotive) role. If you're interested to know more about this opportunity, apply now or you may send your CV to [email protected] Due to the high volume of applications we are experiencing, our team will only be in touch with you if your application is shortlisted.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Responsible for correct operation of physical plant and all engineering facilities of entire property in accordance with established policies and procedures, maintenance program and operation schedule. 2. Responsible for all necessary facilities and equipment repairs in the project ensuring maximum utilization and minimum breakdowns of equipment. 5. Responsible for preparing work schedule of assigned personnel. 6. Responsible for preparing monthly production and consumption report. 7. Responsible for keeping the Property Manager informed of inoperative equipment, progress of work, possible delays, job performance, interest, discipline and discrepancy of his crew. 9. Responsible for correct uniform and neatness of assigned personnel. 10. Responsible for keeping a close watch on spare parts/supplies required and advises the Property Manager beforehand to reorder in order to have at any time expected replacements of parts/supplies on hand. 11. Responsible for order and cleanliness throughout assigned areas. 12. Responsible for ensuring that all safety rules and regulations are adhered to by assigned personnel. 13. Ensures the following: a. All beeps and radios are checked at the beginning of his duty. b. The sound system is checked every hour during his duty. c. Emergency procedures are known by both himself and his crew. d. Fire squads are ready and know their duties. e. All log sheets are completed accurately during his duty. f. Whenever it is not possible to gain entry to an area to affect works, he should immediately notify the Property Manager for proper disposition. g. If difficulties are experienced with any tenant/client, inform the immediate superior. If it is found necessary to remove any piece of furniture or component from a tenant’s/client area, advice the immediate superior as he may consider it necessary to put the area out of order. 14. Willing to be assigned in Pasay area

Company: DYSON ELECTRONICS PTE. LTD. - PHILIPPINE BRANCH
Job Description: Main Duties/Responsibilities: Organizational: Drives discipline team to support departmental goals and long term technology road map. Plan and manage progress of actions, in order to deliver on time. Provide inputs to yearly goal setting. Technical Integrity: Holds responsibility to deliver to assigned projects in area of Structural and Moulding analyses. May own design specifications within projects and could be expected to ensure that the product design satisfy the requirements. Manage related technical risk actively and provide mitigations as needed. Ensure timely closure of risk items. Resolve FRACAS in timely manner. Provide technical oversight to junior members of team in area of Structural and Moulding Analysis. Career development: Take ownership of personal career development by setting out immediate and long term plan together with line manager. May manage development plan of discipline engineers. Coach discipline engineers as part of their development plan. Problem Solving: Expected to resolve problems within project effectively while managing stakeholders’ Experience Required: A Bachelor degree in mechanical/mechatronics engineering or equivalent, preferred applicants have a Master degree. 8+ years of experience in mechanical product analysis & development, preferably in the consumer electrical appliance industry. In-depth knowledge of solid mechanics, engineering mechanics, structural mechanics, and moulding. In-depth understanding of the principles and application of structural analysis (FEA), and/or moulding process analysis, modal/vibration analysis. Advanced user in UG NX, ANSYS and Moldflow, or similar. Experience in hardware and software for measurement and data acquisition (e.g. B&K Pulse, strain gauge, MATLAB and Labview, etc.) is preferred. Technical and problem solving skills Ability to gather information systematically to establish facts and principles required to solve complex problems within the project, typically without precedents. Demonstrated ability to assess multiple viewpoints/argument independently, and determine technical path forward for project. Proficient in root cause analysis techniques. Able to coach less experienced engineers. Ability to plan ahead, prioritise tasks and coordinate the work of others, typically within a project team. Able to identify and manage technical risks within projects. Expected to provide mitigation plans, with impact across the project. Proficient in FMEA techniques and able to coach less experienced engineers. Interpersonal skills: Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills in English. Ability to receive constructive feedback and coaching, and respond appropriately. Able to coach less experienced engineers. Proficiently communicate ideas and concepts, frequently tailoring communication to suit different levels. Ability to persuade and influence others as needed, typically within a project team. He must provide leadership in process flow, data gathering, production reporting functions to accomplish continuous improvement in the department, to include but not limited to process innovation, process development, statistical process control that will achieve greater daily throughput in first pass yield, increased material efficiency, cost reduction, on time delivery target and reduced rejection while maintaining strong internal customer awareness to meet process and product specifications. The incumbent also ensures that the manufacturing process will deliver products on time and to quality in line with the customer requirement. Prepares and revise work instructions, guidelines, forms, monitoring formats, process time, standard procedures and other documents related to production. Train, supervise and manage production line workers. Ensures the group's compliance to the quality controls and system established by the department. Job Responsibilities: Manage mechanical design works, research applicable design criteria, attend project meetings, communicate with members of the project team, and report progress to the Design Coordinator. Coordinate all technical and administrative elements of each allocated design project to ensure all work is delivered in a professional, effective, and efficient manner while applying sound engineering principles. Deliver innovative, sustainable, efficient, safe, practical, and intelligent mechanical engineering solutions on all projects and other activities, appropriate to the stage and type of project. Design mechanical and electromechanical equipment and systems by developing and testing specifications and methods. Perform calculations and analysis on the proposed mechanical devices and equipment. Ensure that installation and operations conform to standards and client requirements by preparing mechanical systems specifications and technical drawings. Ensure compliance with specifications, codes, or client requirements by directing or coordinating installation, manufacturing, construction, maintenance, documentation, support, or testing activities. Develop solutions to challenges within budget, schedule, and project constraints. Ensure health and safety are considered at all stages of the design process such that the designs produced minimize risk during construction while exceeding the client’s expectations. Prepare drawing packages for all stages of projects from Basis of Design, Schematic Design, Design Development, Construction Documents, and Contract Administration. Ensure quality and efficiency for assigned tasks and deliverables. Actively work on high-level tasks and deliverables for multiple projects simultaneously. Prepare for regular project team meetings pertaining to project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Review shop drawings and samples to ensure drawings and finishes match specifications. Revisit designs and make adjustments to designs as needed. Liaise with various professionals and departments to coordinate project details. Qualifications: A Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering Active license to practice from the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) is required. Accredited and a member of their respective profession’s organization. In-depth knowledge of HVAC systems. Well-versed in international and local codes, standards, and regulations. Good written and verbal communication abilities, including preparing and giving presentations. Proficient in Autodesk Revit MEP, BIM 360 Cloud, and other design software. At least 5 years of experience in design and construction projects. Must be willing to work on-site.

RESPONSIBILITIES: The S&D Reservoir Engineer is responsible for planning, organizing, coordinating, designing and conducting well and reservoir modeling initiatives, resource assessment studies, advanced well testing and analysis and recommend solutions to resource management constraints that conform to operating and quality standards of the company. Conceptualizes and tests appropriate resource management and development strategies for the interpretation of the dynamics of the reservoir and ensuring the sustainable and optimized performance of the geothermal resource. These inputs guide management in decisions that are critical to the company's economic sustainability and growth. The Reservoir Engineer is responsible for providing high-quality technical services to clients using industry-standard simulation software, high-performance computing resources, and state-of-the-art modeling techniques. He/she is also responsible for preparing the project budget. Formulates resource characterization and capacity prediction strategies relevant to all well and reservoir analytical and numerical modeling, resource assessment, advanced well testing and analysis to ensure compliance with the organization mandate and customer requirements; Plans, organizes, controls, and coordinates reservoir engineering activities that are aligned with the sustainability initiatives and priorities of the company; Plans, organizes, and coordinates assigned S&D activities to ensure established work standards and objectives are met; Recommends programs and budgetary/ resource requirements for the implementation of reservoir engineering activities, in coordination with concerned groups; IMPLEMENTATION: Performs assessment to diagnose operational needs and concerns of the company and to evaluate impact of technical issues to resource sustainability and operational efficiency; Conceptualizes and performs resource sustainability studies and creates solutions that will address concerns of the company; Leads a sustainability team project related to reservoir engineering and modeling starting from the preparation of project charter, preparation of work program, stage gating, and implementation; Leads cross-functional work teams who will address issues on efficiency and quality of operations of the company, if needed; Secures resources based on the company’s strategic requirements, and seeks alternatives if necessary; Performs reserve estimation and resource assessment studies to determine the field generating capacity that will serve as input to the development strategy and evaluating the feasibility of the project; Initiates well and reservoir evaluation and interpretation and related activities for the business unit to resolve sustainability and developments issues such as but not limited to sustainable production levels and optimum production and injection well performance using both industry standard and company-developed methods such as well test analysis and modeling; Formulates detailed, cost effective, and appropriate technical solutions to optimize well and reservoir performance through the conduct of special research studies and application of appropriate methods; Performs well productivity prediction to determine the new well capacity and resource sustainability studies that will serve as input to the well geoscientific prognosis and drilling strategy; Recommends and leads the design of special well testing programs to measure specific well and reservoir properties; Prepares or assists in the preparation of feasibility studies and economic assessments of proposed projects and programs of the Strategic Business Unit Sustainability Team and collaborates with the Strategic Business Unit Sustainability Team in the preparation of project and program proposals; Reviews and endorses Terms of Reference (TOR) for 3rd party service providers to ensure conformance of service to the company's requirements; Evaluates and recommends 3rd party service providers, as needed, in accordance to Corporate policies on engagement of external services; Evaluates effectiveness of program/project based on operating standards and compliance with agreed actions, and recommends remedial actions when needed; QUALITY MANAGEMENT: Participates in the periodic review and updating of quality standards relevant to resource characterization and capacity prediction activities and well design and intervention strategies including but not limited to, operating procedures, project/program approval criteria, etc. Reviews wellbore and reservoir modeling results and performs quality check of relevant data using applicable software; Develops, implements, coordinates and monitors quality standards in collaboration with relevant stakeholders and subject matter experts, including but not limited to, operating procedures, project/program approval criteria, etc. CLIENT MANAGEMENT: Provides diagnosis/technical analysis of operational and resource management needs and concerns of clients by conducting appropriate reservoir engineering analysis and providing appropriate engineering solutions Convenes, represents the team in routine and high level strategy meetings, as required, to align projects, programs, and work prioritization with Management, Commercial/Operational Teams, and other stakeholders relative to the short, mid, and long term strategies of Resource Management. DOCUMENTS / DATA MANAGEMENT: Implements and maintains information management systems and/or software applications to ensure data security and data integrity for Sustainability and Development operations. Maintains and updates a data and information dashboard relevant to achievement of Resource Management’s strategic requirements. Develops, documents and implements procedures that support the policies on the safekeeping, upload, retrieval, distribution and retention of documents relevant to the Sustainability and Development operations such as, but not limited to, research materials, technical documentation, etc. Coordinates with IT and other groups for the development, maintenance and improvement of the database and information management system related to Reservoir Engineering. POLICY FORMULATION PROCESS / DESIGN / PROCESS IMPROVEMENT: Develops and amends systems, processes, an procedures within S&D to increase operational efficiency Coordinates with relevant stakeholders and subject matter experts for evaluation and feasibility studies of new technologies and techniques which can be adopted for process and systems improvement.Recommends innovations in reservoir engineering practices and techniques and solutions to technical issues RESOURCE/ LOGISTICS / FACILITIES MANAGEMENT: Plans, acquires and manages utilization of the resources allocated to each facility related work program and when applicable, develops strategies to manage resource limitation. Assists in the preparation of, and administers operating and capital expenses budgets for the Sustainability and Development Team projects and activities. Conducts proper inventory, handling, storage and maintenance of S&D equipment to ensure availability of such equipment, instruments, materials and relevant supplies at all times, and recommends corrective/preventive action when appropriate. DUTIES: The Process Engineer is responsible for designing, implementing, standards setting, controlling and optimizing industrial processes, monitor the equipment and processes that turn raw materials into end product.He/She will oversee daily operations and ensure the efficiency of all processes and procedures, with the primary objective of improving and streamlining workflow, in a safe and cost effective manner. Environmental, Health and Safety and Process Safety Management • Ensures implementation of Cargill environment, and health and safety (EHS) and Process Safety Management (PSM) procedures in refinery operations. • Evaluates risk/loss potential to personnel, equipment and plant operations and participates in safety and environmental audits. • Participates in waste minimizations program. • Support and review accident or near miss investigations. • Ensures all of risk follow up action plan will be closed on time. • Conducts regular workplace inspections and risk assessments Productivity • Analyze process flow in plants to determine how the individual plants can perform and work better. • Analyze project designs and process flow to help find ways to cut costs. • Review the KPI monitoring systems and determine ways to improve their ability to maintain plant operations. • Provide manufacturing data, i.e. production control charts, reliability, process capability, to improve the process and monitor and measure progress to target. • Train and supervise staff on new development processes and technology. • Improve continually existing operation, for increased quality, productivity, efficiency and cost savings. • Investigate operational problems, affecting production and reporting, and recommenending solutions. • Leads continuous improvement programs • Deliver monthly reports on budget performance and stock check reports. • To assist the Refinery Manager as per instructions given. Food Safety, Quality and Regulatory • Participates in Process Quality and Food Safety non-compliance issues review meeting. • Works with FSQR team, crush team and the refinery team to define the root causes of non-compliance quality issues and close those findings as soon as possible. • Support in implementation of HACCP, Food Safety and Food Defense programs. • Participate in customer and regulatory audits, and mock recalls. • Develop working instructions and standards, process documents, and ensure they are followed.

Company: Maxeon Solar Technologies Pte. Ltd. (SunPower Philippines Mfg. Ltd.)
Job Description: How do you build a better tomorrow? A spirit of constant improvement has made Maxeon Solar Technologies the world-renowned leader in solar innovation, and we thrive together to lead the fight against climate change. The energy market is roughly $4 trillion globally, and solar penetration is less than 1%. But just one hour of sunlight, if harnessed, could power the entire world for a year. We have the opportunity to completely change the way energy is produced, distributed, and consumed on a global scale, and we’re looking for talented, committed people to help us drive our growth and achieve our goals. Maxeon Solar Technologies is a global leader in solar innovation. Built from 35 years of boundary-pushing solar DNA, the company launched as an independent entity following its spin-off from US-based SunPower Corporation in August 2020. Maxeon designs, manufactures, and sells industry leading SunPower branded solar products in more than 100 countries through a global network spanning more than 1,100 sales and installation partners. And Maxeon is powering positive change every day with a brilliant, passionate, and driven team of more than 5,000 in Latin America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. We push the boundaries, taking solar technology higher, faster, and farther than before. We hold ourselves to a higher standard, striving for the highest integrity, safety, and quality. And we thrive together as a global team, embracing our diverse backgrounds to make a positive impact on the world. Join us in POWERING POSITIVE CHANGE™ SUMMARY OF ROLE The Equipment Design and Deployment Engineer is responsible to define, design, select/source and purchase for new tool platforms. Manage equipment projects and interface with external vendors/material suppliers, consultants, customers, etc. to meet project objectives and timelines. Lead equipment source inspection, installation, start-up, qualification and final acceptance tests. Innovates focusing on tool or process step simplification and cost reduction. Responsibilities Design, prototyping and test Programming and modification trouble shooting and repairs Create shop drawing of electromechanical parts Drives tool design and conduct detailed design reviews RELATED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS Graduate in Engineering Mechanical Engineering Good understanding of fundamental, theories and principle of Engineering, Physics and Chemistry. Proficient in Solidworks / Cad software Knowledgeable in rapid prototyping method like 3d printing Experience with mechanical design, automation and controls preferred

Prepare detail/layout plans for mechanical, gas lines pertinent for building permit application and for construction drawing package. Research, design, and evaluate mechanical products, equipment, systems, and processes to meet requirements through the aid of engineering principles. Apply engineering principles and practices to emerging fields, such as robotics, waste management, and biomedical engineering. Able to do a Fire Protection Plan, FDAS Plan, & LPG Plan is an advantage. Keen to details & team player Must be willing to reside in Eastwood Libis, Quezon City

JOB OVERVIEW: Ensures that periodic inspection and audit of Terminal Equipment are properly done in accordance with the standard operating procedures. Ensures that proper manning of different sections of engineering are properly implemented to ensure both preventive and corrective maintenance are properly done within the acceptable time frame. Recommends appropriate technical advice for engineering facilities and maintenance and corrective and preventive maintenance sections to align the same with general standard. Detailed technical knowledge of lifting equipment mechanisms, critical components and the appropriate maintenance, inspection and testing of such items.

Role Objectives: To develop industry knowledge of international design standards through internal technical training, certifications and continuing education. To acquire the technical knowledge and practical skills through involvement with various projects. To provide technical support into assigned projects under the professional supervision from Senior Engineers, Principal Engineers, Function Leaders and/or Design Managers. To acquire leadership, people management, and delegating skills. Responsibilities The main responsibilities of this role include, but are not limited to: TECHNICAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Apply technical engineering techniques and methods using international design standards such as UK, US, and Middle East Mechanical Design Codes. Prepare drawing markups, calculations, schedules, and other design related documents as assigned by the SE, PE and FL. Conduct internal review and quality checks of engineering drawings and design calculations to ensure compliance with the project’s requirements. Prepare and register all relevant documentation and design reports and ensure all documentation is accurate and in compliance with the Arcadis requirements. Apply engineering solutions, techniques and methods to design of mechanical business solutions such as heating, ventilation, and air conditioning. Participate in the resolution of technical issues. Liaise with other disciplines within the MEP Project Team for coordination MEP works and ensure all requirements are understood. Learn and apply REVIT/BIM Technologies and emerging technology. COMMERCIAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Record man-hour charges accurately into weekly timesheets and ensure correctness of project and non-project man-hour charges. To be fully utilized. Always seek new work/tasks from Senior Engineer. PEOPLE MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES: Resource and develop skills and knowledge base of Assistant and Graduate Engineers assigned to projects. Familiarize the CIBSE Training and Development Scheme and render mentoring duties to all Assistant and Graduate Engineers based on the CIBSE Competence Criteria. Liaise with BIM Managers and BIM Coordinators assigned to projects. Self time-management OTHERS: Take responsibility for defined tasks within prescribed limits. Gain experience and proficiency in Arcadis systems and procedures. Become familiar and compliant with Health and Safety regulations and guidelines. Perform other duties and responsibilities as required from time to time by your manager or Arcadis. Qualifications and Experience MUST BE AMENABLE TO WORK UNDER 12 MONTHS PROJECT-BASED CONTRACT Graduate of Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from recognized University. Belong to the top 20% of the engineering class. Licensed Registered Mechanical Engineer (RME). 5 to 7 years of relevant post-graduate experience. Excellent English written and verbal communication skills. Excellent mathematical skills applied in engineering calculations. Organizational skills and proactive approach in project management. Ability to provide solutions to technical problems. Ability to lead, with good influencing, motivating and delegating skills. Proficient in the application of international design standards: UK, US, and Middle East. Proficient in the following mechanical engineering design fundamentals: heating, ventilation, and air conditioning, etc. Knowledgeable in AUTOCAD, Navisworks and REVIT. Knowledgeable in using the following engineering software: REVIT IES, HAP, SKETCHUP, PIPEFLO and NAVISWORKS. Actively continue to develop personally and technical knowledge and new emerging technology through regular CPD training.

Job Description: -Diagnoses, services and repairs various systems that are found on pieces of heavy equipment such as mechanical and electronic controls, air brake systems, transmissions, high voltage generators, and pneumatic systems; -Troubleshoots and repairs malfunctions in the equipment; -Fabricates, modifies and installs special equipment or replacement parts; -Performs routine maintenance checks and adjustments on fluid levels, hoses, belts, brakes, tires and clutches; -Changes filters and oil, and lubricate vehicles and motor driven equipment; -Diagnoses problems, disassembles units, repairs or replaces parts, and reassembles units; -Overhauls engines, replaces engines, and rebuilds components; -Tunes gas and diesel engines; services valves; fuels filters and turbo chargers; and pressure checks fuel filters; and -Prepares work orders and cost material estimates. Skills and Competencies: -Mechanical aptitude; -Knowledgeable about the fundamentals of diesel engines, transmission, electrical systems, computers, and hydraulics; -Care and use of hand and power tools employed in all phases of heavy equipment mechanical maintenance and repair work; -Ability to make skillful, controlled manipulations of small objects to repair equipments; and Ability to read, understand, and carry out oral and written instructions. Physical Attributes and Characteristics -Flexible and have the capacity to learn new skills quickly; and -Physically fit (i.e. can move heavy objects; bend or stoop repeatedly over time)

Prepare detail/layout plans for mechanical, gas lines, and the likes; signing and sealing plans pertinent for building permit application and for construction drawing package. Read and interpret blueprints, technical drawings, schematics, and computer-generated reports. Confer with engineers and other personnel to implement operating procedures, resolve system malfunctions, and provide technical information. Research and analyze customer design proposals, specifications, manuals, and other data to evaluate the feasibility, cost, and maintenance requirements of designs or applications. Specify system components or direct modification of products to ensure conformance with engineering design and performance specifications. Research, design, and evaluate mechanical products, equipment, systems, and processes to meet requirements through the aid of engineering principles. Investigate equipment failures and difficulties to diagnose faulty operation, and to make recommendations to the maintenance crew. Oversee installation, operation, maintenance, and repair to ensure that machines and equipment are installed and functioning according to specifications. Conduct research that tests and analyzes the feasibility, design, operation, and performance of equipment, components, and systems. Recommend design modifications to eliminate machine or system malfunctions. Estimate costs and submit bids for engineering, construction, or extraction projects, and prepare contract documents. Apply engineering principles and practices to emerging fields, such as robotics, waste management, and biomedical engineering. Qualifications Candidate must possess at least a Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Mechanical) or equivalent. At least 4 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Preferably Supervisor/5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employee specialized in Engineering - Mechanical or equivalent. Must have experience with retail and commercial projects. Able to do a Fire Protection Plan, FDAS Plan, & LPG Plan is an advantage. Keen to details & team player Must be willing to reside in Eastwood Libis, Quezon City

Position Purpose: Promote products and services of Fil-Jap Rayvie Precision International Inc. The main purpose of the company is to supply to different Philippine manufacturing companies nationwide by using improved quality OEM replacement parts developed by FJRPII including customized shredder/crusher/ pulveriser machinery. Maintain good relationship with clients to establish business relationships, help them improve manufacturing operations and lessen downtime. Thru this, we can easily convince customers to buy from us and thus target excellent sales. Must be willing to undergo different trainings in the company to become a good Sales Personnel and later become Technical Sales Personnel Here, we can contribute to lower customers’ use of foreign currency. That means we can help the Philippines’ economic stability and help customers lower stock inventory since we are a local supplier of OEM replacement parts. We create local employment for better family relationship and be proud as a part of Filipino-made products and services. Education: BS Mechanical Technology graduate or equivalent Experience and Skills: Experience in sales and marketing products/services Technical knowledge or experience in a machine shop set-up Must have driving skills with driver’s license Owns and drives motorcycle Competencies Required: A positive and determined person Willing to do research, develop business opportunities and product improvements Ability to handle work pressure Knowledgeable in using personal computers and related softwares Ability to gather data, compile information, and prepare reports Skill in organizing resources and establish priorities Ability to create, compose, and edit written materials is an advantage Ability to use own initiative and pay attention to details Excellent organizational and time management skills A positive attitude, can work independently, responsible and honest Strong communication skills in written and oral is an advantage

I. JOB SUMMARY The position's primary responsibility is to ensure an efficient, correct, timely and safe repair of all mechanical equipment and its auxiliaries in the plant. The position holder is also responsible in small project fabrication, piping and installations. II. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Repairs and maintains all mechanical equipment and its auxiliaries in the plant and ensures that works are done timely, correctly with minimum wastage and downtime on all plant equipments following established work standards and practices. 2. Reports to his immediate supervisor whenever problem or trouble in the plant arises. 3. Performs fabrication and installation works and the process piping that goes with it according to drawings. 4. Contributes ideas on improving correct work system. 5. Ensures availability of necessary materials needed to perform assigned tasks. 6. Updates all records and data in all works done on equipment and its auxiliaries. 7. Ensures that related tools to the trade are kept in working condition. 8. Observes safety practices during work. 9. Maintains the section and his workplace intact and in clean condition. 10. Performs other related tasks that may be assigned from time to time. III. JOB DIMENSION 1. 100% Compliance to Safety and Housekeeping Guidelines. 2. Well-maintained mechanical tools/machineries and equipment. 3. Minimal machine breakdown due to mechanical trouble. 4. Strict observance of working hours, punctuality and attendance as well as adherence to company rules. IV. INTERFACING ENTITY 1. Production Supervisor 2. HR - Admin Staff 3. Materials Handling Staff V. QUALIFICATIONS A. Essential Competencies 1. Must be at least a vocational course graduate in mechanical repair, or its equivalent. 2. Must have a minimum of two years experience in similar line of work. 3. Must possess excellent health and must have no allergies to chemicals. B. Desirable Competencies 1. Preferably a Mechanical Engineering or Trade School graduate. NC 2 Certification holder on SMAW or TIG. 2. Ability to learn fast, master new techniques and routine. 3. Adequate knowledge in industrial safety, pollution control and environmental restrictions. 4. Hardworking and full attention to details. 5. Flexible and with good interpersonal relationship skills. WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY? - Great Pay - Career Growth and Advancement - Company Initiated Benefits (Leaves, Monetary and Non-Monetary Benefits) * Our office is located at Lot 3, Block 2, People's Technology Complex - Brgy. Cabilang Baybay, Carmona, Cavite. ONLY QUALIFIED CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED WITHIN THE NEXT 2 BUSINESS DAYS UPON DATE OF APPLICATION.

Facilities General Manager (Cebu)Integrated Facilities Management – Corporate Solutions - Philippines What this job involves: Leading on-site operationsAre you a pro at giving on-site support and professional workplace management solutions in the BPO or Shared Services industry? Are you a licensed Electrical Engineer with a healthy mix of experience in workplace facilities and building management? Working with a team, you’ll oversee the day-to-day client activities for the assigned property or facility. You’ll also implement building procedures and performance measures—and ensure that they are maintained at all times. Likewise, you’ll boost on-site operations by promoting best practices and creating better processes. This job will also entail the question “How do I ensure the safety of my colleagues?” You will do this by promoting adherence to health and safety standards. Winning our clients’ trustAs the facilities manager, you’ll be working frequently with clients, so you’ll need to build strong relationships with them. Likewise, you’ll need to be proactive and engaging; and make sure that the clients’ expectations are met each and every time. You will also be the go-to person for any facilities-related concerns. Keeping an eye on budget and contracts Do you have a solid background in finance management? As the person in charge, you will take care of the site’s financial operations. Also part of your job is to coordinate with vendors and suppliers, and make sure that they deliver quality work practices according to the contract, and at the right cost. Promoting teamwork across the boardAt JLL, we strongly believe that teamwork is the secret behind every successful company. Do you share our thoughts? If so, then you are what we’re looking for. In this role, you will support our people’s growth and development through effective training and coaching sessions. Likewise, you’ll promote a culture that upholds the ‘I am JLL’ core behaviours and fosters teamwork, cooperation and performance excellence. Also part of your job is to ensure that the team is constantly motivated, and that trust and work ethics prevail among members. In this role, you’ll also be working with different kinds of people, so you’ll need to be an expert in handling them professionally. Likewise, you’ll need to effectively manage, train and inspire the team to always do better. You’ll also need to take the time to listen to your people to create better work impact. Job Details Full-time · PHP20,000 - PHP30,000 / month Calero, Lilo-An Job Description We are looking to hire a skilled Outboard Mechanic to inspect, service, and repair marine engines for our clients for Boat Classified Services Center-Porters Marina Calero, Liloan OUTBOARD MECHANIC EXTENSIVE OUTBOARD EXPERIENCE A MUST! DO NOT APPLY IF YOU HAVE LITTLE OR NO EXPERIENCE AS AN OUTBOARD MECHANIC! What we are asking for: Marine Mechanics, also known as Motorboat Mechanics, are skilled mechanics who service and repair electrical and mechanical equipment on marine vessels. You will be tasked to work with our lead mechanic doing the repair and maintenance of all marine engines including outboard motors, inboard motors, and large diesel ship engines from inboard gas and diesel to outboard 4-stroke and 2-stroke motors. You will be responsible for traveling to the dock or seaport where the vessel is located with company vehicle, inspecting and servicing engine equipment, troubleshooting, and making minor repairs. You may also be required to address problems with boat steering and hydraulic systems. To ensure success as a Outboard Mechanic, you should have knowledge of motorboat engines not just outboards, be able to work on land and at sea, and be able to diagnose problems with electrical systems. You will learn and work with our lead Marine Mechanic OUTBOARD Mechanic Responsibilities: • Traveling to marina or dock where the vessel is located. • Testing the performance of marine engines and electrical systems. • Carrying out services and minor repairs on outboard, inboard, and ship engines. • Conducting plumbing and intake repairs. • Troubleshooting engine and electrical problems. • Replacing broken or worn-out engine parts. • Repairing faulty hydraulic and steering systems. • Conducting electrical AC system maintenance. • Completing service records and repair documents. OUTBOARD Mechanic Requirements: • High school diploma or GED. • Degree in Mechanical Engineering preferable. • Proven work experience as a Outboard Marine Mechanic. • Knowledge of marine engine and electrical auxiliary systems. • High-level welding skills. • Knowledge of marine hydraulic systems and related parts. • Ability to lift heavy equipment and work in confined spaces. • Ability to work at sea. • Knowledge of boat steering systems. Boat Classified Services Center-Porters Marina Calero, Liloan Boat Classified Services - Showroom Cebu Yacht Club Lapu-Lapu, F. Martir St, Lapu-Lapu City, 6015 Cebu

Job Description: Be part of the leading outsourcing company in Facility Services. ISS Facility Services Inc. is currently in need of a Senior Facilities Manager for our client in Batangas (PMFTC). Position Summary Facilities Manager will manage all aspects of Facilities Hard and Soft Services across all PMFTC sites. He/She will manage and provide technical support to the Technical Leads to execute the professional way pf pro-active preventive maintenance of all critical equipment (HVAC, Mechanical, Electrical) to lessen or zero out the reactive maintenance and to ensure all best practices are being applied/carried out properly in all Facilities Hard and Soft Services. He/She will be responsible for the Multi-Skilled Technicians skill enhancement plan for the repair, maintenance of all critical equipment and the accuracy of inspection/judgement for all facilities related items needed to be repaired or restored. Key Responsibilities Responsible for the overall client site’s Critical Facilities Equipment Quality Preventive and Corrective Maintenance through strict implementation of PM schedule, Site Walks and Quality Audits as proactive approach to see all the facility items needs to be corrected/repaired, and scheduling/planning improvement for non-standards findings. Work with the Key Account Manager to assist in the preparation of the final budget documentation/plans and administer works to ensure budget compliance. Inspect facilities/equipment to determine the extent of service and equipment required. Arrange for alterations, maintenance or reconditioning of facilities, as specified in the operating procedures or MSA/LIA. Prepare a periodic inventory of Premises contents and property condition and forward the listing to the Key Account Manager for review. Support the Key Account Manager relating to the delivery of all FM services. Review and manage the Preventative Maintenance deliverables of the IFM team and Service Providers. Review vendor management contract. Additional responsibilities will be Project Management, this is to improve all critical facilities Flexibility, Operations/Functionality, Redundancy/Back-up, PM and CM schedule. Help to implement and manage risk management programs, disaster recovery and business continuity plans. Provide technical know-how to staff as maybe required in analyzing and resolving issues that may arise. Leading a team of staff (where applicable), including the management of staffing plans, work allocation and managing poor performance. Fostering a working environment that promotes a learning culture consistent objectives and values, including the training and development of staff and monitoring of staff performance. Follow escalation and incident reporting procedures and comply with the Company’s guidelines and strategies. A high level of commitment to providing a safe working environment for all staff, contractors, clients and visitors. Knowledgeable in the Global/Local Health and Safety Environment Protocols. Ensuring that all defined services are completed in accordance with all operating procedures and within the company and client SHE guidelines. Role Competencies Registered Electrical or Mechanical Engineer. Leader with exceptional communication skills (Verbal and Written) Client focused and a Team Player. Strength in Administration and Budget Compliance. 5 years minimum experience with utilities engineering in a manufacturing set-up (Fast-Moving Consume Goods - FMCG) Structured and Organized. Can readily adapt to changes as the client may require. Has outstanding analytical capabilities in trouble shooting. Extensive knowledge on utility systems (eg. Steam, HVAC, compressed air, vacuum, electrical systems)
